## I am a...

* **Data analyst** at [Trying Together](https://tryingtogether.org/), a non-profit organization supporting the work of early childcare and education.
* **PhD candidate** in Cognitive Psychology at the University of Pittsburgh working with [Melissa Libertus](https://www.lrdc.pitt.edu/people/researcher-detail.cshtml?id=530). My research focuses on:
    + Links between children's **early math** experiences in the **home learning environment (HLE)** and the development of their math skills.
    + Applying **new methods** (i.e., behavioral coding and statistical modeling) to **measuring the HLE**, particularly **interactions** between children and their caregivers.
* [Pie artist](https://s-duong.github.io/art.html)! :)

## Prior to graduate school...

* I managed Lab for Early Social Cognition at the University of Maryland, College Park, under Jonathan Beier.
* I worked as a research assistant at the [Social Cognitive Development Lab](http://www.socialcogdev.com/) directed by Yarrow Dunham at Yale University and under the mentorship of Richard Ahl.
* I worked as a research assistant in the Math Department at the University of New Haven with [Yasanthi Kottegoda](https://www.newhaven.edu/faculty-staff-profiles/yasanthi-kottegoda.php) and [Ramesh Sharma](https://www.newhaven.edu/faculty-staff-profiles/ramesh-sharma.php).
* See more of my experiences [here](https://s-duong.github.io/experience.html)!
